thread.title: EXCLUSIVE: Ryan Reynolds Says Fatherhood Has Made Him 'More Desperate': 'There's Just No Time Anymore'
thread.title_full: EXCLUSIVE: Ryan Reynolds Says Fatherhood Has Made Him 'More Desperate': 'There's Just No Time Anymore'

author: Alex Ungerman
title: EXCLUSIVE: Ryan Reynolds Says Fatherhood Has Made Him 'More Desperate': 'There's Just No Time Anymore'
text: EXCLUSIVE: Ryan Reynolds Says Fatherhood Has Made Him 'More Desperate': 'There's Just No Time Anymore' by Alex Ungerman 4:11 PM PDT, March 19, 2017 Playing EXCLUSIVE: Ryan Reynolds Says Fatherhood Has Made Him 'More Desperate': 'There's Just No Time Anymore' Ryan Reynolds loves fatherhood, but quickly learned that it takes up a lot of your time! Reynolds and his Life co-star Jake Gyllenhaal talked to ET's Carly Steel at the South by Southwest premiere of their new movie over the weekend, where the 40-year-old actor admitted that having kids has given him a little bit of anxiety. "I think you're just more desperate in everything you do cause you're like," he shared. "'I've got 10 minutes to do this, and then I gotta get home for a thing, and a thing, and a thing...'" "There's just no time anymore, so you're hardened by it," he added. "Anxiety, I think, that's probably it." Yep, parenthood will do that to you! Thankfully, Reynolds has the support of wife Blake Lively to lean on as the couple raises their two daughters, 2-year-old James, and 5-month-old Ines. Another thing the Deadpool star has -- bro companionship! MORE: Ryan Reynolds Says Jake Gyllenhaal Cooks 'Just a Little Bit Better' Than Wife Blake Lively Gyllenhaal and Reynolds have really connected since working together on Life , and talked a little bit about their beautiful BFF-ness at the premiere. "There's a certain harmony that comes when we're both together," Reynolds said. Gyllenhaal agreed, "It's a beauty that is unmatched pretty much anywhere, I would think." "Though Garth Brooks may try his hand," Gyllenhaal jokingly added. "I don't think he would come close." [Bing] Crosby and [Fred] Astaire gave it a shot back in [the 1942 film] Holiday Inn, and a few other ones, but nope, not a chance," Reynolds riffed. Clearly, these two enjoy their time together! Watch the video below for more on Life . RELATED SLIDESHOW
